intro: Bulbocapnos cava, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
